main event: A sighting of a fireball with a trail of sparks was reported 10 miles west of Edgemont, North Dakota, on May 10, 1952.
interesting points: The fireball was compared in size to a baseball against the backdrop of the moon., The light emitted by the fireball was described as greenish white., The duration of the observation was 3 minutes., The object did not appear to maneuver and traveled in a straight line., The observers noted clear weather with good visibility during the sighting.
